info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:27PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 715 PM MST... At 626 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of White Tank Mountain Park, or 13 miles northeast of Tonopah. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckeye, Gila Bend, Painted Rock Dam, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg, Hassayampa and Arlington. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 96 and 109. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 97 and 115. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
